page.title: 01 The Hatton area
page.content: This area consists of peaceful countryside. It is an agricultural area about 4 miles north-west of Warwick. There is a lot of grazing land for sheep, cows and horses. Wheat, hay and oil seed rape are also grown. You can travel by train from Hatton station to Leamington Spa, Warwick, Stratford upon Avon and Birmingham Moor St. Freight trains also use the Birmingham - Leamington route, these are mainly coal trains for Didcot power station near Oxford. The Grand Union Canal runs through the area, quite close to the railway line. The main attraction of the canal here is the flight of 21 locks. There is also a Craft Centre for people to visit. The area will be changed soon by a motorway - we think that it will spoil the countryside.
